result.execSummary:
The defendant Trenon D. DENFELD was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling and work towards his high school diploma, GED or HSED.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with any victim unless approved by the agent, except contact with Todd Ward as allowed.

No contact with any of the co-defendants.

Provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, on count 1 only, to commence immediately upon completion of the condition time imposed on 15 CF 2.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: concurrent with 15 CF 2 but consecutive to 14 CF 526.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling and work towards his high school diploma, GED or HSED.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No contact with any victim unless approved by the agent, except contact with Todd Ward as allowed.

Defendant is to have no contact with any of the co-defendants.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.

Defendant in custody.   
Information filed amending count 7 to PTC Burglary of Motor Home or Trailer, contrary to Section 943.10(1m)(e) & 939.05 of the Wisconsin Statutes and adding count 10, PTC Criminal damage to property, contrary to Section 943.01(2)(d) & 939.05 of the Wisconsin Statutes.   Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-14-15 at 11:30 a.m.   Plea date is set for 07-20-15 at 11:00 a.m.   
MOTION HEARING 
Motion to modify bail.  Counsel argue.  Court amends defendant's bond to $1,000.00 cash with same conditions as previously set.

State moves to amend Count 7 to Section 943.10(1m)(e) Burglary of motor/trailer home.  Motion granted.

Minutes.
Amending the Probable Cause portion.
RE:  Bail jumping, on 03-07-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of bail jumpint, PTC criminal damage to property and PTC burglary.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 03-16-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Two Rivers City Police Department  for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and have no contact with Daniel Abts, 2010 Rogers Street, Two Rivers, WI or Dontae W. Rusch.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
